ygData.subject: Re: Looting Robes, and other rants :P
ygData.msgSnippet: did you get my last post?  It has to be in a bag...   then you have to be consented to retrieve the other persons corpse with the robe in a bag on it. Works
ygData.messageBody:
did you get my last post? It has to be in a bag... then you have to be consented to retrieve the other persons corpse with the robe in a bag on it.

Works for me.

*shrugs*

Drev

> ----------
> From: zdogg@...[SMTP:zdogg@...]
> Reply To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 2:20 PM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Looting Robes, and other rants :P
>
> From: zdogg@...
>
> As far as is my experience I have never been able to loot the robe off of a body
>
> that I have been given consent to. So I don\'t see how the plan to take it from
>
> a dark elf would work. Just my two cents.
>
> Also as a newbie to the 8th level, should I get shock of ice or firebolt? I am
> am broke and saving to buy my first new spell. I actually have had luck with
> parties and explain my role so they understand. Buffing the warriors with
> Okeils, does make them apprieciative too. Most like the fact that monsters get
> hurt when hitting them, fits right into the warrior ego/mentality of hurt,
> crush, bash, cut.
>
> Hey, I love the one line remarks but could you maybe just trim all the quote
> crap out except the last message you are one lining, I recently switched to the
> digest version and 90% of that message is quoted spam and headers. Oh well it
> is better than trying to read 110 messages, when only halfway through the first
> you get 10 more. I really didn\'t care but took to long to read that way, easier
>
> in digest (after all I need to read these quick so I can play more EQ). I am on
> 4 other EQ lists too :P still can\'t get enough.
>
> Anyway I am off on another journey.
>
> Zakrul The Traveler
> Companion
> Bristlebane
